WRITING.TEXT: Not sure if trolling or legit question...

Basically off unless a website looks better in landscape. I read somewhere a while ago that having it off saves some battery because the gyro isn't checking for it? Could be total BS, but I prefer it off anyways.

I'm not really sure why you're complaining here. You have a huge amount of choices and different launchers to choose from. Google isn't forcing you to stick with Now launcher, take your pick. If you're insisting on using Now launcher then... deal with it?
Proper paid advertising and product placement at stores, maybe they could turn some heads and convince people. I remember the Z10 in Canada was everywhere when they were pushing it.
To answer it simply. AdAway among a bunch of other things. It comes down to what you deem useful for your device and needs. I have a number of applications that require root.

Is pretty damn decent. Props to LG for the removable battery and SD slot. There's a good selection of expanded batteries for the G4 now which I didn't think anyone was selling. I'm hoping they keep these same features for the G5. Pop a hopefully good SD 820 in there and polish up the UI more and they could dominate in 2016.

Have you considered replacing the battery on your N5? I've taken good care of my battery and it's still giving me reasonable SOT. But I intend to replace it if I continue with this phone until the 820 phones are out.
A Moto G 2015 wouldn't be an improvement over your Nexus 5. Especially if you're in Canada and your only option is the 8gb/1gb ram.
This basically. I can't go without AdAway
Early spec releases of speeds and battery efficiencies are making me consider waiting for the new wave of SD820 phones. I'd be sour as hell if they drop the ball on this one too.
Can confirm, many friends and coworkers own Galaxy S4/5/6, LG G2/3/4, Z1/2/3 and they have virtually no complaints.
Serious question if you know. How hard is it to unlock the bootloader and install a more stock ROM on the G4? My only experience is with the N5 and it's stupid simple.
Don't call me pal, asshole.

I was really digging this phone, but the big emphasis on security is probably going to hurt custom ROM development. Dunno if i can use a phone without root. Won't be for me, but for business and security minded folk, this could be a solid choice.
Thanks for this tip! I was wondering why my readings would fluctuate by quite a bit.
It was more a dig at Apple and it's absurd Canadian pricing.
Try Ampere from the Playstore, it'll tell you how much charge the battery is receiving. I use it to weed out crappy cables and USB adapters.

"the 6s is likely going to be triple the price."
FTFY

Try not to get a shock from licking it so much. Also avoid licking on cold winter days.
Although I preferred the 5X look, the specs are a little disappointing. Unless it's priced just right I'm going for the 6P. But first I want some damn information on the Z5 for Canada. Come on Sony!
Can't upvote this enough
Excellent, ty

Where did you hear this? Last information we received was that only the Z5 and Z5 Premium were coming to Canada. I'm fairly sure Sony outright said, no Z5C for Canada.
It was quite disappointing. If you have information to the contrary it would be much appreciated.
The SD 820 is crumbling my world. I was sure I had my selection down to 4 phones (including the Venice). Then I see the 820 specs and....fuck!

This is my conundrum. I'm shopping around for an upgrade waiting for some of these devices to release. Then I hear about the SD 820 and it's features and how a lot of manufacturers, including Samsung, are all for it. Now I'm trying to decide if I want to upgrade now or keep holding off another ~6 months, or however long it takes for the 820 phones to roll out.
I've been trying for the last couple of days to download MIUI for my Nexus 5 but the file never completes properly. Usually the download stops at ~70mb for a 471mb file. Are there any mirrors?
Once a month or every few weeks is enough. It's actually bad if you do it every day.

I have a dedicated phone pocket. My nexus 5 is coming up on two years and it's in mint condition. No case or screen protector. It's never in a pocket or bag with keys. Been lucky never to drop it. As for battery I do a full charge and deplete once a month. Never leave it plugged in at 100% over night. I try to keep battery between 20% to 80%. Often giving it sporadic short charges throughout the day if I have access to a charger.
Looks like the problems are fixed! http://m.androidcentral.com/google-app-update-brings-moto-x-play-launcher-performance-boost
The pain is more real here
Looked like an uncomfortable crescent moon

Reading through this thread I'm surprised at the amount of people who don't bother installing custom ROMs. Wouldn't that fix all these complaints? You can buy the hardware you want and change the software. Then again, my first android is my current Nexus 5. I imagine it's more of a chore on other phones? Multirom makes this whole task trivial.

Multitasking and battery life to an extent. If the phone closes an app, it'll have to spend more time (and battery) reopening the app when you go back to it. This is why it's recommended to keep apps in the background as opposed to ending them via a task killer.
Honestly for $100 it's a good deal. You're not risking much if you don't like it. Just turn around and resell it for $100.
With HTC's current financial problems, it's buyer beware imo. The G4 has proven to be quite successful and a solid choice for a lot of people. Have you considered waiting for the Nexus 5X?
8GB is painful. You'll only have 4 to 5gb of internal storage. 1GB of ram may be passable. If you can live with that, for the price it's hard to go wrong.

It's difficult to judge right now. There's a lot of complaints about lag and the phone not being smooth. It could be related to 5.1.1 but we won't know for sure until Android M is made available. Hold out maybe?

If camera and battery life rank high on your list of wants, I'd consider looking at something else. I'm an Nexus line die hard, but a bunch of my friends have LG G4's and they love them. Never any complaint about battery or camera.

Thanks for both the XDA review and your input Bluecup. I'm almost convinced about getting one. Gearbest has it here for $169 USD http://www.gearbest.com/cell-phones/pp_188822.html but I can't figure out if it's the Americas or European version. Looking at the bands it seems like it's the Euro one. Do you know of a reliable reseller that has the Americas version? (I'm in Canada)

The z3c is still more expensive and you can imagine how much the z5c will be. I'm in the same boat: 2015 nexus 5, X play, Z5, G4 or OnePlus 2. It'll be a tough choice

+1 to being a content user. Got it December 2013, still solid and working flawlessly. Been using it with cataclysm ROM for the last 4 months and battery life is still decent. I can't get the 5 hours of screen time like I used to before, but it gets me through the day no problem. On heavy use days I'll charge it. The key thing has been taking care of the battery.
Solid since December 2013 as well. I'll be giving it up one the new nexus 5 is out unless OnePlus can wow me next week with their Two

WRITING.TEXT:
5 goals and 53 hits in last year's playoffs, 6'0" 220lbs, I'll gladly take DSP over unproven Sekac for a playoff run. Could Sekac prove to be the better scorer in the future? Maybe. But that doesn't help Montreal right now, especially with how Therrien was handling him. MB also freed up $550,000 cap space, he's probably not done trading yet.
This is a solid trade.
R/TheyDidTheMath
Fuck, I clicked thinking I was going to help someone by answering their question about flying dragon. But I'm met with this rubbish instead.
Sunwuko set, also know as the money kings garb. 4 piece set

If that's all your doing, then you're doing it wrong. Mantra is the main ability you're using sure, but you have to keep breath of heaven up, attack with FoF, use swieepng wind when spirit is filling fast due to FD proc. All the while paying attention to the nasty stuff by dashing in and out of fights.
My keyboard hand typically gets sore by the end of a play session. It's non stop button mashing.

Swk monk is good fun. Yeah the spenders are useless, but being able to get in the frey and attack at lightning speeds makes the manta spamming enjoyable. There's no fire and forget, you constantly have to be juggling 3 to 4 skills for maximum effectiveness.
Banff it is
The technology just isn't there yet.

Hence why I stashed it :)
I guess I was being a bit sarcastic, it's really pathetic that as class we can't even be happy about our 6pc set. But DH, barb(4 pieces), crusader, wd and wizard all have great sets.

WRITING.TITLE: Thousand Storms party foul
WRITING.TEXT:
Playing a seasonal monk, the RNG gods decided to be cruel to me. I managed to gather 5 pieces of 1k storm set plus an alright jawbreaker before paragon 100. I threw it all in my stash without even giving the set a consideration. Furthermore I've been having trouble getting my swk shoulders, instead I've found 6 storm shoulders and 3 invokers. I'm currently playing a sub optimal swk spec with a horrendously rolled swk amulet.
Does anyone else feel the same about our awful 6pc set? Should I even attempt to use it? What's the highest gift stormbreaker could clear?
Dash/cyclone are typically subbed for bells.
Swk and Inna together are best used in a TR wuko build. A monk made a guide the other day. He's cleared 37 on seasonal EU using that setup.

For starters, use a 4th passive, the slot is currently empty. Switch out near death experience for something like harmony or sixth sense. Or both even, you need a toughness boost. Also use a daibo to take advantage of sunwuko bonus, it doesn't apply to other 2 handers.
Drop the red gem in your helm for an amethyst or diamond. Depends of your needs. I can't properly "mouseover" your gear through my phone, but these are glaring changes I can see right off the bat.
Or live chat with them. Usually get through quicker and they're just as helpful and polite.

Get rid of crit hit damage as a stat, adjust game damage and health pools accordingly. Allows players to enjoy more build flexibility and deflates the numbers.
Hell I'd love it if they tested this in seasons and found a way to roll it over to regular.
The technology isn't there yet
All my friends got theirs within the first few drops. Some on the first as well.
I managed to collect all 6 pieces in seasons by paragon 100. I tossed it in my stash and cried a little. Swk shoulders eluding me like a boss.
First leg at 70 was vengeful wind
The technology just isn't there yet. Much like detailed tool tips.
Your face is pointless!

Thanks for the up votes. Another fun fact if you're on a cellphone. Add .compact at the end of any reddit url to switch to mobile view.
http://www.reddit.com/r/diablo+diablo3.compact

http://www.reddit.com/r/diablo+diablo3
Problem solved.

Reminiscent of lightning enchanted monsters from D2.they were the toughest, I don't mind electrified being this hard. We crabby expect blizzard to dumb everything down for us. Either skip like many said they would or try and fight.
Ty
